text: Would not recommend these guys. Very shady company. They overcharge big time especially if you are some sort of business. The invoices they create are very unprofessional. It’s call in shop labor on their invoice. Supposedly they do 4 hours of work within the shop for something that still had to be assembled in the shop. Personally having done different business in different state I have never ran into a glass company that just seemed to do things this way.  Doesn’t seem legitimate.

text: Called to ask about a quote, $80 before any measuring done and at least 2 weeks before coming out to do the quote.... but when the girl on the phone heard that I’d have to call her back without hearing why, she hangs up in my ear!!😡 I’m definitely not calling back now!

resp.text:
Katrina, we have a large area of North Alabama where we provide free estimates at absolutely no cost to the customer.  It includes 72 different zip code areas and most of the metropolitan areas. Unfortunately your home is in Gurley which is not included in the free estimate area.

Our typical time to get out to jobs for estimates has historically been one or two days maximum.  It’s a source of pride for us.  But during Covid many people have chosen to stay home and upgrade their homes.  Unfortunately, like all businesses that specialize in home remodeling, we have a backlog of several weeks of work.  We have been working overtime to get our lead times back to normal and are making headway in catching up.

We offer our sincere apology for any inconvenience this has caused.  We feel it’s more important to be honest and upfront about the current backlog than to promise quicker lead times and then fail to deliver on them.

We have had problems with our VOIP phone system all day, experiencing several dropped calls. Again, we apologize if this has caused any of our customers to feel anything less than important.

name: Casey G
text:
We had a great experience with Madison Glass Company.

We recently replaced the builder grade shower in our master bathroom with a new tile shower. After the tiling was complete, I reached out to five different companies in the area to come give me quotes on a glass shower door and surround as well as an interior window pane for an insulated double pane window that one of kids had managed to crack.

Out of all five companies that came out, I felt like Wade and Kevin from Madison glass were the only ones that tried to assess the job and recommend the best solution for us. They were the only one of the five companies that realized there was not a stud behind the tile where the door was to be installed and actually recommended a solution that ended up saving us money (though they also made sure I knew they were capable of going with the more expensive solution if we decided to go that route).

Using the information that they provided, I was able to go back and get a slightly cheaper quote from one of the other companies. Despite that, I went with Madison Glass because I felt I could trust Wade and Kevin to do the job right. I'm glad I did.

We had a small hiccup with the manufacturer on the first replacement window and shower door that came in, but Wade and Kevin set us up for the mean time and made sure to prioritize getting back out as soon as the replacement glass came in.

The shower looks great, the service was excellent, they let us know what to expect and then kept us informed throughout the process, and we ended up spending less than what we expected. I have already recommended them to a friend and will certainly use them in the future.

resp.text: We understand that it is difficult to find honest, dependable help. As a company, we want integrity to be the norm, not the exception. With custom installations, there are bound to be a few bumps in the road, but it's the way people handle those bumps that truly matter. I'm glad we were able to come through for you!

resp.text:
I do apologize Mr Medders for your slow service. To shed a little light on this if I may. Rodney works at crystal glass and my cousin owns that shop and Rodney needed a glass that had a bevel and that size bevel we don’t do a lot of and he was told 2-3 weeks. Reason for that was when you have large machines to bevel glass and mirrors it’s not very wise to just run one piece of glass with a special set up that’s not done often. We said we would call you if I get it sooner. We do our very best to get your order out just as quick as we can and some things just take longer to produce especially the quality we provide and the service we give. I hope this answers any questions on Mr Medders issues with his slow service. Special requests take extra time to get the perfection we strive for. Thanks and have a blessed day.
Sincerely
Richard
1 Partner in the ownership

name: Daniel Weatherford
text:
Tired of looking at a frosty window.

Pros: Price

Cons: Talks a good talk, but doesn't stand by warranty.

Unfortunately, I would not recommend. Had a 5'x6' window installed on ground level. Installers caulked the outer edges of the window before installing and proceeded to set it on the ground to get a better grip, I guess, picking up mulch and clippings in the sealant. Then seated it with the debris in the seal. I didn't complain and there were no leaks. I forgot about it.

Less than 2 years later, the whole window is completely frosted. Called July 10th about warranty on window, was told there would be a warranty on the window. Took a week for him to pull the paper work. Took almost two weeks for him to call the manufacturer one time, only to leave a VM. No follow up call to them for a week. I've called about twice a week every week since this started and am getting no where. Coming up on a month and has not even made contact with someone at the manufacturer.

Buyer beware.

name: harlee smith
text:
Keith is AH-MAY-ZING! He is not just a windshield "dentist" - he is a windshield miracle worker!! My husband and I were traveling to Tuscaloosa the day before, and a rock hit the windshield of our Mercedes and instantly created about a quarter-sized "firework" (my word - not the technical one, I'm sure!) On the Saturday of Memorial Day weekend, he let us come to his house and we were ready-to-roll in about 15 minutes ... and with a windshield where I could not even identify where the crack was previously!

On another note, we had had a much smaller one previously repaired a few weeks ago, by a "big name" company. And although they were extremely nice and did a good job, I can still see where that one was located - and as I said, it was a MUCH less destructive crack than the one Keith literally erased from our windshield.

Very nice man - great work - great price - in-and-out in 15 minutes. Cannot ask for more.

text: I was en route from Birmingham to New Orleans for a concert with my kids. After leaving Bham, I noticed that a crack in my windshield had grown since it happened last weekend. Concerned, I stopped in Tuscaloosa and called Glass Dentist. Keith walked me through what my options were and assured me that it would be safe to drive and get fixed when I returned to Birmingham. I appreciate him sharing his time and expertise. I would have him fix it if I lived in Tuscaloosa.  Very grateful.

name: Peyton Grantham
text: Excellent customer service. I called this morning to get my windshield repaired, he gave me a time to be there and gave me an estimate of how long to expect and he was true to his word! Never treated me any different as a female client like experiences with other auto technicians. Very thorough explanation of everything he did and was very reasonably priced. Will definitely use him again.

text: I went to The Windshield Dentist to get 2 small chips repaired. Keith was very nice and very knowledgeable. He was sure to explain everything to me. He repaired my windshield in less than 20 minutes. Initially I went to Safelite for a quote. Then I came across The Windshield Dentist. He does good quality work for a MUCH better price.

text: Keith did an amazing job on my windshield. He is very professional and affordable. The fact that he also will come to you is amazing. He fixed my windshield in like than 20 mins and I had a pretty bad crack. Would gladly recommend him to others

name: Rachel Savage
text: Keith did an amazing job on my windshield! A few rocks had flown into my windshield and Keith agreed to meet me where & when it was the best for me and fixed all 3 cracks in such a short time frame! It was so much cheaper than safelite and I highly recommend the windshield dentist!

name: Dean Gendron
text:
My daughter had a crack in her windshield from the highway.  I called Keith and he was incredibly helpful and honest.  His first thought was to repair the crack versus replace the window to save money.

Upon further inspection, the windshield needed to be replaced.

Keith and his co-worker, Jerome, met my daughter at her dorm parking lot and replaced the window at a time she was not in class.

I live in Atlanta had handled this over the phone with Keith.  He is incredibly professional and responsive.

Keith is also a headlight magician!  He restored her headlights and they literally look brand new.  I have literally spent hundreds of dollars trying to do it myself to no avail.

I would recommend Keith to anyone living in the Tuscaloosa area or anyone that has a student living in the area!

name: Ashley McDavid
text: Keith at The Windshield Dentist is awesome.  He helped repair the crack in my windshield after Safelite failed to.  He is so nice and helpful.  His prices are very reasonable and he is very knowledgeable.  I would recommend him to anyone!

I highly recommend Mr. Hayes and his services!

name: EVERYTHING CHILDERS
text:
On Tuesday, my last shopping Pier 1 businesses ended in Jones Valley.
Gave both locations great support.  However...the Jones Valley stop CSR's had been polite & answered questions...but wouldn't help gather my large quantity of items. I had to gather, lift, & carry them.
Following Spine & Hip injections, this was strain to my back & painful. Afterwards, I struggled walking. The associate permitted me to use their plastic cart. After leaving, I was complaining to myself, as I crossed the street to my car. A lady, carrying Bath & Body bag, crossed as well. I commented about the associates at the store being lazy.
As that person went on. I loaded my things & was leaving the cart on the grass.  The lady in the parking area yelled & demanded I return the cart. I didn't fully understand. So, I asked again what she said. She made her demand on me about 3 times.
I asked her if she worked there? She said yes.  I asked if she was a Manager? She said Yes!
I tried to tell her about the laziness I was dealing with.
She became irritated with me. No peaceful problem solving was enacted.
She came hurriedly at me. I asked her to stop. I warned her, she was crossing the line.  She came anyways, within inches of me, calling me lazy, grabbed my cart without my permission, & proceeded to the store, being loud, calling me lazy repeatedly, & told me to never step foot in her store again!
She definitely broke the Covid rules, & came to close to me besides, causes me to feel uncomfortable.
I requested the 911 service & filed a report.
The Manager, should have been more professional.  She ordered me to never come back & she don't have to worry.  I don't want to!!!
All I can say is remember when shopping at the Jones Valley location, to take help for you, because they are not much help.  And watch out for the Quick Tempered Manager.
It's 4 AM & my Spine & hip still hurt.  This  is a shame!
🥺😢

name: Joshua Trotter
text: Was not able to purchase my items. Store did not have sufficient change for my transaction so I was told to come back at a later date. So what your telling me is that it is two weeks before Christmas, the store has been open for several hours and you don't have change for a hundred dollar bill? Why would you even open up for business without change to operate with? How many other paying customers were unable to make a cash purchase?  Staff was rude and the store manager would not even come out of the back room to talk with me? Good luck Pier 1...

name: Debbie Daniel
text: I have tried for two years to have a glass company come and look at a custom made double paned window that needed the inside glass replaced.  No luck.  Then I thought I will try one more time.  I call Huntsville Glass, Mr. James Davis came out and looked at the window, they called and gave me the estimate, and once the glass was in Mr. Davis came back and installed the glass.  He was exceptionally professional, let me know when he would be out and in no time it was done.  I really appreciate the service.  The window looks great.  I will do business only with Huntsville Glass.  I highly recommend them.

resp.text: Wow Debbie! We hate to hear that you ran into so much trouble before you found us. James is definitely an asset to our company as well as to our customers. Thank you!

name: Debbie Schaffer
text: We are repeat customers - this is our second glass shower door installed by Huntsville Glass, and we are extremely pleased. From our first phone conversation, the installer coming to the house to measure, and the actual installation, Huntsville Glass was professional, courteous, careful, and did excellent work.The first door was installed over 4 years ago and still looks beautiful and works like new today. The second door - a slider door, is only a week old, but we are loving it. If we needed a third shower door, I would call Huntsville Glass! Over the years, I've also had various pieces of picture frame glass and mirror glass cut to size and had excellent service too. Thanks to installers John and Curtis!

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know you have had a great overall experience with us over the years Debbie. We are always glad to hear our technicians and staff are taking great care of our customers. We look forward to continuing to help you with your glass and mirror needs!

Today was our 2nd time to use them for this service and they were once again a pleasure to work with.

resp.text: Always a pleasure to hear from repeat customers. We hope to always be your "go to" for any and all of your glass needs.

resp.text: Ryan, we are so glad to hear about your pleasurable experience. It's always great to hear when our employees put extra effort into customer service and communication. We look forward to serving you again!

name: Sheryl Payne
text: Recently a rock got flung toward my storm door while the front yard was being mowed.  I had one of those decorative films on the window pane that actually kept the glass from shattering everywhere. I called HSV Glass and working with the support team was very easy. I accepted the estimate and 3 weeks later my new window pane is installed. Mr. John May and Mr. James Davis, Sr. came out this morning and did a great job of removing the old shattered pane and installing the new one.  I was told to let the window 'set' for about 24 hours to really let the seal do it's job and after that I can put a new film on if I wanted.  I really appreciate the work the guys did and of the great customer support /service from Ms. Sherri.

resp.text: Sheryl, we appreciate you taking the time to share your experience. We understand that dealing with the unexpected can be difficult. So glad to hear that we provided such service.

name: Jon Hutchinson
text: Very pleased with Huntsville Glass. Very friendly, courteous and professional staff. James and James Jr. did a fantastic install of a new pane to replace one that was broken by a flying rock.

resp.text: Thank you Jon!!

name: Derrick Graham
text:
I wanted to share my testimony. It’s long but it just shows how much this company cares.

I took my broken window glass to Huntsville Glass for repair. They gave me a temporary one because it would take around five weeks for permanent fixture to  return for pickup.  During this time, I took my bent screen frame to them, or so I thought.  I was told they were unable to do the work and referred me to another company in Huntsville.  Due to my poor memory, I forgot about the conversation. I called to inquiry when would the work be completed. They searched and searched around their facility and couldn’t find it.  To make a long story short, they went the extra mile and called other glass and screen repair companies. They found my screen, through their tireless efforts, they coordinated with those companies to get it repaired. Then, they called me and told me where it was and gave me the number. I was so impressed and I felt bad because I thought they had it.  I apologized and to my surprise, they were very kind and patient with me.

I said all of that to say this!!!!! THIS COMPANY CARES ABOUT YOU AND YOUR BUSINESS!!!!!’ Thank you all for being so professional and patient with me.

resp.text: Its great to know that some businesses still care about their customers. It is an honor to be included in that prestigious group.

text: Huntsville Glass showed up to estimate and installation appointments on time and swiftly made the repair.  Their price was extremely fair and competitive.  Their installers explained the job to us in detail, making us feel very comfortable with the quality and timeliness of the work being performed.  We'd give them a 15/10 if we could!

resp.text: Meghan, we really appreciate you letting us know that you had a great overall experience. We are glad to have been able to help and would be happy to help with any future glass needs!

name: Bob B.
text: Hsv Glass installed a glass walk-in shower for us. Their technicians, John Saeger & Curtis Campell, were prompt, professional, and completed entire job in 2 hours.  It looks beautiful. We would definitely use them again.

resp.text: Bob, we appreciate you taking time to tell us about your experience. We are lucky to have such talents on our team. We look forward to working with you again!

name: H2Brew
text: In this case, do not buy local. I could have saved over $700 buying this glass online, and it would have arrived already, but I really wanted to support local businesses. I spent over $1100 for a few pieces of trapezoids and rectangles at 5/8" low-e. It has been over a month and the glass is still not here. Just excuses about broken or mis-sized pieces. I will have the glass someday, it will probably be the wrong size and I will have to live with it. Never again though.

name: Mike Tilley
text: My experience with Huntsville Glass has been totally positive.  They have been friendly, helpful, courteous, prompt, competent, and go the extra mile.  They will get my future business.

resp.text: Mr. Tilley, thank you for sharing. We look forward to working with you again.

name: Jeffrey Boudreau
text: John and James were excellent! They arrived exactly when they were scheduled to, took very little time to get the job done, and were very courteous and prompt about updates with the job itself. Our new window looks great!

resp.text: Jeffrey, thank you for taking the time to let us know how great our technicians did. We really appreciate your feedback. If you have any future glass needs we would be happy to help!

name: Edie Hermes
text: Excellent work and friendliness. Very prompt and precise. Also fairly priced. James Davis Sr & John May are my favorite - they have been out a few times and are outstanding

resp.text: We are so glad to hear you have had several outstanding experiences with our company, Edie. We really appreciate you sharing about your overall experience and would be happy to help you again in the future!

name: Lori Hall
text: If I could give 10 stars, I would. From start to finish Huntsville Glass Company was professional and speedy! I called to get an estimate on a half round window that had a broken seal. They came out within a day to give me an estimate and it was replaced within two weeks. John and James were an amazing team.  I was so impressed I asked them to replace the glass in a master shower enclosure. They measured while they were there, and I had an estimate within a few days. The glass came a week earlier than expected, and James and John came back and replaced the whole enclosure in less than an hour. Such a great experience. Thank you!

resp.text: Lori, your thorough review is greatly appreciated. We are glad to have been able to help you and see that our technicians took great care of you with all of your glass needs. If you have any future glass needs we would be happy to help!

name: Chad Bickford
text: We had an accident with a window at home. I've done business with these wonder folks through work on multiple occasions and I didn't think twice about calling them first. I was given a fair price and a 2 to 3 week date of turnover. Day 13 and the window is back in with a perfect fit. Angie, again I want to thank you and the guys for such great service and customer service. I'll throw all the business I can at y'all. Thank you so much!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Chad. We are grateful for your loyalty and really appreciate you taking the time to give us a thorough review. We look forward to helping you in the future!

name: Eric Skeldon
text: Had 3 windows replaced. John May and James Davis (installers) did a very professional job. Lowe's wanted to replace the entire window sills for the 3 windows. John and James gave me an estimate to replace the glass only. Less than half the price of Lowe's. They took the window frames apart and replaced the glass. In and out in couple hours. Job well done.  Highly recommended.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing Eric. Sadly we hear similar stories all the time where people are told by other companies that they have to replace the entire window and not just the glass. I am glad you found us and that our technicians took great care of you. If you have any future glass needs we would be happy to help!

name: Jimmy Parry
text: The outside pane of glass on one of our windows was broken by a bird or a frisbee.  We called HSV Glass Company, they sent someone out to give us an estimate. We paid for the glass,  They were very flexible as we had to reschedule the installation many times.  James Davis Sr. and James Davis Jr. came out and replaced the broken window glass.  They were professional and fast.  I will be calling them again when I have broken glass in the future.

resp.text: FANTASTIC! Your feedback is very much appreciated. It's great to hear that our guys were able to accommodate your scheduling needs. We look forward to working with you again.

name: Grace Black
text: Called to get an estimate and the woman on the phone was so rude! They obviously don’t care about doing business with people or fostering lasting business relationships to encourage repeat customers. I guess they don’t need business. Called K&M glass instead and they were so friendly and answered all my questions. Will recommend K&M to everyone that needs glass repair!

resp.text: Grace, we are so incredibly sorry that you had a bad experience. That is never our intention and we are addressing the problem. If you call back and ask for Stephanie she will take great care of you. We sincerely apologize for the bad customer service you received and we hope to be able to earn back your business in the future.

name: Margaret Dukeman
text: As usual Stephanie was a delight to work as was your new employee.  However, when I arrived your other employee who sits in the West corner never made any motion to see or ask if I needed any help.  As I stood there waiting and waiting.  Finally Stephanie peeked our from what looked like a lunch area to see if I needed help.  She was obviously at lunch but she stopped her lunch and came out and helped me.  Still the other lady never did look up or ask if she could help.  This isn’t the type of service I have grown accustomed to at your place of business. Your company is far better than that.  You got five stars because of Stephanie and her exceptional attention to detail and always providing me with exactly what I needed!  Not just every store is willing to work with an artist and their creative ideas and carry them through in a stellar manner.

resp.text: Margaret, we really appreciate you providing a thorough review of your most recent experience. Your feedback is very important to us and we will do everything we can to ensure a better experience the next time. We hope to continue to be a great source for your glass needs.

name: Becky Kelly
text: Three of our sunroom glass doors needed to be replaced.  Huntsville Glass got in the doors in less than three weeks and John came out to install them.  They look beautiful!!  Thanks so much for your hard work!  Will definitely call Huntsville Glass the next time we need glass work!!

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know about your experience Becky. We are glad to hear the replacement glass looks great. We would be happy to help you again in the future!

name: Mary Thompson
text: They underpromised and overdelivered.  I needed replacement glass for a double hung window that had lost its seal. I was told it would be a couple of business days before they scheduled a measurement appt and they scheduled the next day!  I was told it would take 2-3 weeks for the replacement glass to be installed and John May and James Davis, Sr.  were back the next week to install. They were in and out in less than 15 minutes!

resp.text: With so much going wrong, it sure is nice when something goes right. We are at the mercy of our distributors with regards to receiving the products we order in a timely fashion. Unfortunately, things don't always go as planned. We are so glad they came through for you and we were able to get it installed so quickly.

name: Meike Fisk
text: I was selling my property and had two windows that needed replacing. One had thermal seal failure and one was broken.  I had gotten a quote from a “window” company and they said the whole window plus the transom above it would have to be replaced and their cost was over 1700.00.  I called another glass company and they have yet to call me back to even come out and look at replacing the glass only. I called  Huntsville Glass and I believe they came out within 2 days to measure and give me a quote. It was under 600.00. After I gave them the go ahead to order the replacement glass I was told it would take 2-3 weeks and that was fine with me but they came in at least a week sooner and they installed them within two days of calling me to say they were in!! John and James arrived right on time and were finished quickly and left behind no mess.  The even answered my questions and explained the process to me patiently.  I will definitely use them again!  I appreciate their exemplary customer service!

resp.text: Meike, we are so glad to have been able to provide you with a great experience and are thankful that you took the time to provide an in depth review. We really appreciate your feedback and will be happy to help you in the future!

name: Mike Brown
text: Great job.  John May and James Davis Jr. arrived on time and were very courteous.  Worked around other contractors.  Office staff were very helpful.  We have used Huntsville Glass for decades and never been disappointed.

resp.text: We are so glad to have your continued business Mike. Thank you for taking the time to share your experiences. We look forward to assisting you in the future!

text: I'm allergic to cats...and was greeted by one when I entered the door. Honestly I don't know more to say. I left quickly.

If you can let us know that you have an allergy to cats before coming to the store or tell us you have an allergy when you walk in the door we will gladly put the cat up. We are sorry to have inconvenienced you and would be happy to earn your business in the future.

name: Blake Hargrove
text:
*** UPDATE ***
Rating - 3/5
The manager called back, apologizing for the experience we had. He seemed very sincere and wanted to earn our business, but we had already signed an agreement with a different company.

Where the individual we interacted did not show professionalism and courtesy, Huntsville Glass Company's manager did. We'll consider them for service in the future, solely based off our interaction with their manager.
******

Rating - 2/5
I'd consider giving a better review if I could actually get them to come out and provide an estimate. For 2 weeks, we've been attempting to get on their schedule. Instead, we get last minute phone calls stating that they're in the area and can stop by. If we could get maybe a 2 hour head's-up, we could accommodate Huntsville Glass' busy schedule.

Our most recent interaction ended with the individual hanging up abruptly. I suppose they're busy enough they don't need to take the time to schedule estimations with customers 2 hours in advance.

text:
I would not recommend this place.  The front desk has about the most unfriendliest, unhelpful ladies I have ever worked with.  After more than two weeks when the glass was finally ready for pickup they left a message that it was ready and for me to bring my own packing material because it will not be in any packaging there….  Really?
It also took two trips with all the measurements they ask for the glass, and I even provide pictures since it is going in an old house with no square corners.  After picking the piece up, packing it in my own material and getting it home, it did not fit.  I took the glass by Absolute Glass Service on Church and without an appointment or calling they had it cut correctly and the edges polished in five minutes for the whole sum of ten dollars.  I gave them a twenty for being so customer oriented.

text: We were traveling in a motorhome and the windshield was hit by a rock from a passing semi. Created a pretty big star chip in the windshield. We were about three hours west of Annsiton. Called Glass Doctor, although they were booked for the day Cheryl said she would see if they could help us after we arrived at the Gander RV park in Anniston. She called us back just as we were arriving at the RV park. She told us the tech would be calling us shortly. He did and arrived within 30 min. Although the damage to the windshield  was larger than a quarter he repaired it and the results were perfect. Thank you Cheryl for making the extra effort to get us service and thanks to the tech for the excellent job.

name: F. Slate
text: Mirror Renovations has restored my faith in D.I.Y. home projects! On Pinterest to frame your bathroom mirror it involved me owning and operating a miter saw, taping pieces up after applying liquid nail glue and it was all just to much! Mirror Renovations allowed me to enter my measurements online, pick out my frame I wanted and they shipped it to me for free. All I needed to assemble my frame was a Phillips head screw driver and I had a brand new mirror up in less than 10 minutes. It covers my mirror clips and the frame is flush to the mirror, no one can tell it wasn't hung as one piece. I tell everyone about you guys and I am so grateful to you!

resp.text: Thank you! We are so excited to hear about successful D.I.Y. renovations with our mirror frames. We loved your before and after images you sent us and we cant wait to share them!
